sentences.en: Absolute liberty is absence of restraint.
sentences.cn: 绝对的自由就是无约束.

sentences.en: Do not take our restraint for a sign of weakness.
sentences.cn: 不要把我方的克制看做是软弱可欺.

sentences.en: Gandhi exemplified the virtues of renunciation, asceticism and restraint.
sentences.cn: 甘地体现了克己、禁欲和自我约束的美德。

sentences.en: He sued them for restraint of trade and won.
sentences.cn: 他控告他们实行贸易管制，并且胜诉了。

sentences.en: He urged restraint on the security forces.
sentences.cn: 他力主对安全部队设限。

sentences.en: His affections were kept under continual restraint.
sentences.cn: 他的感情一直受到压抑.

sentences.en: I am under no restraint whatever.
I'll speak to the staff and ask them to exercise restraint and common sense.
sentences.cn: 我会和员工谈一谈，要他们加强自制，理智处事。

sentences.en: Physical compulsion or restraint was effectual, of course, while it lasted.
sentences.cn: 当然, 体罚和管束在施行的当时还是有效的.

sentences.en: She exercised all her self-restraint and kept quiet.
sentences.cn: 她好不容易才忍住没说话。

sentences.en: She told me without restraint all about her married life.
sentences.cn: 她毫无保留地告诉我她婚后的生活.

sentences.en: The parties involved should exercise ( self - ) restraint and prevent the situation from getting worse.
sentences.cn: 有关各方应采取克制态度,防止事态扩大.

sentences.en: The police were praised for their restraint in handling the demonstrators.
sentences.cn: 警方因对待示威者时所表现出的克制而受到赞扬。

sentences.en: The Supreme Court has also called for judicial restraint in this area.
sentences.cn: 最高法院在这一领域也要求司法抑制.

sentences.en: They behaved with more restraint than I'd expected.
sentences.cn: 他们表现得比我预料的更为克制。

words.tran_cn: 克制的，受限制的；拘谨的
[摄] 抑制剂（尤指摄影中用的溴化钾等）；限制器；控制者

phrases.tran_cn: 无拘无束地；自由自在地

trans.tran_cn: 抑制，克制，控制，限制，拘束，约束力
trans.tran_en: calm sensible controlled behaviour, especially in a situation when it is difficult to stay calm
